intro: Pseudocentrum silverstonei, commonly known as the Silverstone's arrow poison tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Philippines. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
